medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Periumbilical pain started 2 days prior to presentation, initially attributed to food. Pain then migrated to pelvis bilaterally. Associated symptoms included nausea (no emesis) and anorexia, with the last bowel movement occurring the morning prior to presentation. No change in bowel habits. No dysuria or hematuria. No fevers, chills, or night sweats at home. Patient was febrile to 101.0 upon admission.
medical_history.family_history: Father diagnosed with colon cancer at age unspecified. No other colorectal cancer or inflammatory bowel disease in the family.
